Bookshig Class Reference

A managed object which stores the configuration settings of a Bookshelf The name is a contraction of "Bookshelf Configuration". More...

Detailed Description

A managed object which stores the configuration settings of a Bookshelf The name is a contraction of "Bookshelf Configuration".

One, and only one of these, is inserted into a new Bookshelf when it is initially created.

There are two ways to handle the Automatic configuration (configureAutomatically).

  • The first way would be to to write custom getters for all of the collection-support attributes:
    • satchAll1
    • satchAll2
    • hasBar
    • hasMenu
    • hasOhared
    • hasUnsorted
    • rootLeavesOk
    • rootSoftainersOk
    • rootNotchesOk
    • softainersAnyRootIndex
    Each custom getter would have to iterate through the internalizers and calculate the required setting.  And this would be calculated during normal program operation.
  • The second way would be to set KVO observers which, if configureAutomatically is YES, iterate through the above list of affected attributes and calculate a required setting for each one and set it.  This will be done only when internalizers were changed, practically, once a year.  Two observers are required, though: One to observe 'browfile' of Ixternalizer and one to observe 'internalizers' of Bookshig.

    Obviously, the second way is less code and more efficient to run, so I do that.  It will also cause the disabled attribute settings to display as the current, automatically-calculated values instead of holding on to the last manually-set values.  I feel that displaying this more correct information to users would be better than holding onto the last manually-set values, since it only takes nine clicks at most to restore the last manually-set values.

Member Function Documentation

- (IBAction) addNewAgent  

Action which invokes newInternalizerAtIndex:NSNotFound, to create a new internalizer at the end, but does not return it.

Action which invokes newExternalizerAtIndex:NSNotFound, to create a new externalizer at the end, but does not return it.

Action which invokes newAgentAtIndex:NSNotFound, to create a new agent at the end, but does not return it.

- (NSArray *) agentsOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's agents objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (NSString *) attributeKeyForHasHartainerSharype: (Sharype)  sharype  

Returns one of the four hasXXX keys corresponding to a given hartainer sharype.

Parameters:
sharype One of the hartainer sharypes SharypeBar, SharypeMenu, SharypeUnfiled or SharypeOhared
Returns:
Either constKeyHasBar, constKeyHasMenu, constKeyHasUnfiled or constKeyHasOhared

- (void) doAutomaticConfigurationIfNeeded  

If the receiver's configureAutomatically is true, sets the receiver's collection-support attributes according to the browfiles of the receiver's current internalizers.

The collection-support attributes are listed in the class description.

- (NSArray *) externalizersOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's externalizers objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (NSArray *) internalizersOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's internalizersOrdered objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (Agent *) newAgentAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Agent, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's agents, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Agent in the receiver's externalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Agent.
Returns:
The new Agent

- (Ixternalizer *) newExternalizerAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Ixternalizer, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's externalizers, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Ixternalizer in the receiver's externalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Ixtnernalizer, or NSNotFound to use the next index.
The array controller in the nib does not use this method.

Returns:
The new Ixternalizer

- (Ixternalizer *) newInternalizerAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Ixternalizer, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's internalizers, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Ixternalizer in the receiver's internalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Ixtnernalizer, or NSNotFound to use the next index.
The array controller in the nib does not use this method.

Returns:
The new Ixternalizer

- (void) setAgentsOrdered: (NSArray*)  newObjects  

Removes old and sets new objects into the receiver's agents set, conferring order by setting the -index of each object in the array.

Triggers KVO notifications.

Parameters:
newObjects The array of new objects, each of which must conform to the SSYIndexee protocol, i.e., have an 'index' property.

- (void) setExternalizersOrdered: (NSArray*)  newObjects  

Removes old and sets new objects into the receiver's externalizers set, conferring order by setting the -index of each object in the array.

Triggers KVO notifications.

Parameters:
newObjects The array of new objects, each of which must conform to the SSYIndexee protocol, i.e., have an 'index' property.

- (void) setInternalizersOrdered: (NSArray*)  newObjects  

Removes old and sets new objects into the receiver's internalizers set, conferring order by setting the -index of each object in the array.

Triggers KVO notifications.

Parameters:
newObjects The array of new objects, each of which must conform to the SSYIndexee protocol, i.e., have an 'index' property.

- (BkmxSortBy) sortByValue  

Returns the value of the receiver's sortBy attribute.

/*!

Property Documentation

- (NSSet*) agents [read, write, retain]

An ordered set of the automated Agents currently assigned in the receiver.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members. Ordering is only necessary in this case to give the user a consistent table display.

- (NSNumber*) configureAutomatically [read, write, retain]

A number BOOL indicating whether or not the receiver's collection-support attributes should be configured automatically to support the union of those attributes supported by all internalization sources.

The collection-support attributes are listed in the class description.

- (NSNumber*) defaultSortable [read, write, retain]

A number indicating how starks in the receiver's document whose sortable attribute is BkmxSortableAsDefault should be sortable; the default value of sortable for starks in the receiver's document.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmxSortable values.

- (NSSet*) externalizers [read, write, retain]

An set of the Ixternalizations which should be executed when the receiver performs a Sync Out.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members.

- (NSNumber*) ignoreDisparateDupes [read, write, retain]

Indicates whether or duplicate pairs in different collections should be detected when finding duplicates in the receiver.

The value of the number should be a BOOL, YES or NO.

- (NSSet*) internalizers [read, write, retain]

An set of the Ixternalizations which should be executed when the receiver performs a Sync In.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members.

- (NSNumber*) rootSortable [read, write, retain]

A number indicating whether or not the root item of the receiver is sortable.

The value value should be one of the BkmxSortable values, except not BkmxSortableAsParent since root does not have a parent.

- (NSNumber*) satchAll2 [read, write, retain]

A number Sharype indicating the alternate collection into which dead-end starks should be placed in the receiver.

This alternate is use in the event that satchAll1 is SharypeRoot, and some stark is not allowed in root,as indicated by rootLeavesOK, rootSoftainersOK or rootNotchesOK.

- (NSNumber*) sortBy [read, write, retain]

A number indicating which attribute to sort items by in the owning Bookshelf.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmxSortBy values.

- (NSNumber*) sortFoldersAt [read, write, retain]

A number indicating where folders should be sorted with respect to bookmarks in the receiver.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmxSortFoldersAt values.

- (NSNumber*) tagDelimiter [read, write, copy]

A string used to delimit the receiver's tags when the user types into token fields.

If this string is found in a receiver's stark's tag, it will be converted to an underscore.

- (NSString*) visitor [read, write, copy]

The bundle identifier of the web browser which the user prefers to use when visiting a bookmark.

A nil value indicates to use the user's default web browser.
